feed.title: TAMU Mathematics News
feed.subtitle: News in the Texas A&M University Department of Mathematics

entry.title: awards16
entry.summary: Departmental Teaching Awards went to Dean Baskin and Joungdong Kim, departmental Service Awards to Rashi Arora and Mike Pilant. Citations are here.

entry.title: CAREER
entry.summary: Assistant Professor Dean Baskin has been awarded an NSF CAREER grant.

entry.title: UG research
entry.summary: Jeffrey Lagarias of the University of Michigan is delivering this year's Undergraduate Research Lecture on March 1. CoS article.

entry.title: Hagler
entry.summary: Hagler Institute for Advanced Study (formerly TIAS) Symposium, Fedruary 22-24, 2017.

entry.title: GermanWings
entry.summary: Gordon Chen et al. article on the crash of Germanwings flight 9525 is an Invited Comments article inthe focus issue on 21st century frontiers of Physica Scripta. CoS press release is here.

entry.title: STEMfest
entry.summary: Math Booth at Texas A&M STEMfest 2017, Saturday February 4. See here for pictures (both training and actual event).

entry.title: MAA Poster
entry.summary: One of our undergraduate students, Meghan Shanks, received an Outstanding Poster Award at the MAA Student Poster Session at JMM 2017.

entry.title: Timo
entry.summary: Timo de Wolff has been awarded a prestigious Emmy Noether Fellowship by the DFG which will fund a junior research group under his direction for five years at the Technical University of Berlin.

entry.title: DeVore
entry.summary: For the third year in a row, Distinguished Professor and Holder of the Koss Professorship in Mathematics Ron DeVore is among Thomson Reuters' Highly Cited Researchers. CoS article is here.

entry.title: Nobel
entry.summary: The Colleges of Liberal Arts, Medicine, and Science are teaming up for a Nobel Prizes `Symposium' Friday, Dec. 2 at 4:00pm in the Hawking Auditorium. Eric Rowell will elucidate some ideas behind the Physics Prize involving topological phases of matter. See also CoS article and Eagle article.

entry.title: Guseman
entry.summary: Graduate students Sourav Dutta and Fulvio Gesmundo awarded the L.F.Guseman Prize in Mathematics.

entry.title: AMS Fellows
entry.summary: CoS article on Efendiev and Landsberg's election as AMS Fellows, class of 2017.

entry.title: Kerr
entry.summary: David Kerr will have an exhibition of his photography `Reconfiguring Natures' at the Stark Galleries in the MSC, Nov. 10-23. See CoS article.

entry.title: AMS FEllows
entry.summary: Yalchin Efendiev and JM Landsberg have been named Fellows of the American Mathematical Society, class of 2017.

entry.title: Math Contest
entry.summary: Our annual High School Math Contest will take place Saturday, October 22. See CoS news article.

entry.title: MathFest
entry.summary: Nathan Mehlhop, one of our undergraduates, received a certificate for Outstanding Presentation at this summer's MathFest at the MAA Student Paper Session. Congratulations!

entry.title: Math competition
entry.summary: Christian Williams, one of our Math majors, placed third in the National Math Problem Solving Competition at MathFest.

entry.title: Moler
entry.summary: Article by Sourav Dutta on MATLAB creator Cleve Moler's visit to TAMU in SIAM News.

entry.title: SeeMath
entry.summary: SEE-Math in session (July 18-29); see CoS article.

entry.title: Fatma
entry.summary: Graduate student Fatma Terzioglu in SIAM News.

entry.title: Smart
entry.summary: SMaRT Camp currently in action; CoS article.

entry.title: MPE
entry.summary: Our Calc 1 Math Placement Exam now marketed nationwide by WebAssign.

entry.title: Gamble
entry.summary: USAF General (ret.) and 1967 Mathematics graduate Patrick K. Gamble named Texas A&M Distinguished Alumnus by the Association of Former Students.

entry.title: Fatma
entry.summary: Fatma Terzioglu has been awarded a SIAM Student Paper Prize for her paper `Some Inversion Formulas for the Cone Transform'. CoS article.

entry.title: Math Fair
entry.summary: Our annual Math Fair is to be held on Saturday, April 16, in connection with Math Awareness Month. CoS article is here.

entry.title: Sue 100
entry.summary: Sue Geller graduates her 100th Mathematics Master's student, James DeVinney'15. CoS article is here.

entry.title: Guseman
entry.summary: March Boedihardjo and Fatma Terzioglu are this year's recipents of the Larry Guseman Prize in Mathematics.

entry.title: Putnam
entry.summary: Our Putnam team placed 58th out of several hundred teams at this year's competition. Two team members, Advait Parulekar and Matthew Kroesche, earned individual distictions for placing in the top 500 out of 4275 contestants. The team is coached by Doug Hensley.

entry.title: Janie
entry.summary: Janie Schielack has been named Impact in Training & Learning Award recipient at the 2016 Research-to-Practice Conference at SMU.

entry.title: Dutta
entry.summary: Sourav Dutta wins second place in Math/Stat/CompScience oral presentation at Student Research Week.

entry.title: Laura
entry.summary: Laura Matusevich will give an Invited Address at the AMS Spring Central Section Meeting in Fargo, April 17, 2016. Here is a companion piece in the Spring Sectional Sampler.

entry.title: ICTCM
entry.summary: Mike Pilant has been named a Fellow of the ICTCM at its 2016 session.

entry.title: Bangerth SIAM
entry.summary: SIAM News front page article by Wolfgang Bangerth, Juliane Dannberg (Research Visitor), Rene Gassmoller (Research Visitor), Timo Heister (former post-doc), on Computational Modeling of Convection in the Earth's Mantle.

entry.title: UG Research
entry.summary: Richard Stanley of MIT is the inaugural  speaker in the department's new Undergraduate Research Lecture in Mathematics series.

entry.title: best math
entry.summary: The 50 best mathematics programs in the world. See also CoS article.

entry.title: college video
entry.summary: New CoS video LEARN FROM THE BEST.

entry.title: Ghesmati
entry.summary: Arezou Ghesmati has been named co-winner of the AWM Poster Session at the JMM in Seattle.

entry.title: Janie
entry.summary: Janie Schielack designated member of the Texas A&M System Academy of Teacher Educators. See CoS article.

entry.title: Kuchment AAAS
entry.summary: University Distinguished Professor Peter Kuchment has been elected a 2015 AAAS Fellow. See also CoS article.

entry.title: Batt article
entry.summary: Batt article on Flight 370 and supercomputing.

entry.title: Contest
entry.summary: Our annual HighSchool Math Contest was held Saturday, Oct. 24.

entry.title: Grad student reviews
entry.summary: Graduateprograms.com has announced its Fall 2015 rankings of the top Mathematics graduate programs according to graduate students, ranking the department #8.

entry.title: rankings
entry.summary: US News and World Report has published its new Best Global Universities research rankings. In mathematics (which comprises mathematics plus statistics), our ranking is #17 (up from 21 last year). See also the Shanghai rankings, #14.

entry.title: highly cited researcher
entry.summary: For the second year in a row, Distinguished Professor of Mathematics Ronald DeVore has been recognized by Thomson Reuters' Highly Cited Researchers. DeVore is the holder of the Walter E. Koss Endowed Professorship in Mathematics.

entry.title: SIAM student chapter
entry.summary: Our new SIAM Student Chapter has been approved by SIAM. Peter Kuchment is the faculty advisor.

entry.title: Math Fest award
entry.summary: Our UG student Madeline Hansalik received an award for student research/presentation at this year's Math Fest for her presentation on Magnetic Spectral Decimation on Self Similar Fractals.

entry.title: honours for Kuchment
entry.summary: Peter Kuchment elected Senior Member of IEEE

entry.title: AMS Fellow
entry.summary: Thomas Schlumprecht has been named to the 2016 class of AMS Fellows.

entry.title: Outstanding Staff
entry.summary: Judy Muzny will be a recipient of the 2015 College of Science Outstanding Staff Achievement Award.

entry.title: 2015 REU
entry.summary: Results (and photos) of 2015 REU.

entry.title: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation
entry.summary: Our Fast Track student William Linz has been awarded a $10,000 scholarship from the Astronaut Scholarship Foundation. See CoS article.

entry.title: Berkolaiko and Baskin to speak at ICMP
entry.summary: Dean Baskin and Gregory Berkolaiko  will speak at this year's International Congress on Mathematical Physics, Santiago de Chile, July 27 - August 1, 2015. Berkolaiko will speak in the session on Quantum Mechanics and Spectral Theory; Baskin will speak in the Annales Henri Poincare Prize event, as winner of the 2013 Birkhauser AHP Prize.

entry.summary: Arezou Ghesmati and Guanglian Li named co-winners of AWM Poster Session competition

entry.title: youngster shines at IMO
entry.summary: Alex Whatley, a high-school student enrolled in the TAMU maths programme as a non-degree-seeking student, wins bronze medal for Canada at the recent International Mathematical Olympiad

entry.title: MathFest Awards for A&M students
entry.summary: A&M maths students who won awards at this year's MathFest:  Daniel Miller (SIAM Prize) at the Pi Mu Epsilon Student Sessions;  Will Linz (third place in the problem solving competition); Aditi Ghosh (runner-up for the best AWM poster at the meeting)

entry.title: Promotions
entry.summary: Promotions, effective September 2014: Oksana Shatalov to Senior Lecturer; Riad Masri to Associate Professor; Michael Anshelevich, Gregory Berkolaiko, Grigoris Paouris, and Zoran Sunik to Professor

entry.title: Transitions
entry.summary: Senior Lecturers Angela Allen, Ben Aurispa, Kathryn Bollinger, Joe Kahlig, Kendra Kilmer, Greg Klein, Heather Ramsey, Sherry Scarborough, Mariya Vorobets, and Jill Zarestky appointed Instructional Assistant Professors, effective September 1, 2014

entry.title: Landsberg honoured
entry.summary: J.M.Landsberg to hold Chancellor's Professorship at UC-Berkeley's Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing, during the Fall semester of 2014

entry.title: AFS honours for DeVore, Linhart, and Walton

entry.title: Former student honoured
entry.summary: Mark Stern has been inducted to the College of Science Academy of Distinguished Former Students.  Stern took his undergradute degree in maths from Texas A&M University in 1980.

entry.title: AWM poster presentations
entry.summary: Doctoral students Van Nguyen, Sofia Ortega-Castillo, and Tracy Weyand presented posters at the Association of Women in Mathematics Workshop Poster Competition in Baltimore; Weyand tied for first place awarded to the most outstanding graduate student research poster.
